results.idea: Net institutional buy momentum
results.description: Uses two high-coverage fields to capture momentum in net institutional flows. S1: used multiple fields (bought and sold). S2: no vector fields present so vec_* not applied. S3: coverage=1.0 so ts_backfill not needed. S4: chose inst6_value_of_institutional_shares_bought/sold (high userCount). Confidence set to 0.72 because institutional flow momentum is a common predictive signal but can be noisy.

results.idea: Institutional buyers acceleration
results.description: Detect accelerating institutional buyer counts. S1: used buyer count and its time delta. S2: no vector fields. S3: coverage=1.0 so no backfill. S4: used inst6_num_of_institutional_buyers (very high userCount). Confidence 0.65 — acceleration is meaningful but count data noisy.

results.idea: High buyers to holders ratio (crowding shift)
results.description: Capture sudden increases in buyer activity relative to existing holders. S1: two fields used (buyers and holders). S2: no vector fields. S3: coverage ok. S4: used inst6 fields with high userCount. Confidence 0.68 because ratio often predicts re-rating.

results.idea: Value-weighted net institutional inflow
results.description: Net dollar inflow scaled by holdings to prioritize meaningful flows. S1: two fields (value bought, value held). S2: no vector. S3: coverage=1.0. S4: using inst6_value_of_institutional_shares_bought and inst6_value_held_by_institutions (good userCount). Confidence 0.7 — value flows tend to be informative.

results.idea: Net share flow ratio (shares bought / shares sold)
results.description: Cross-sectional signal of buying pressure in share counts. S1: two fields used. S2: no vector. S3: coverage ok. S4: inst6_num_of_institutional_shares_bought/sold used (high alphaCount). Confidence 0.66 — share flows informative but affected by corporate events.

results.idea: Short-term institutional flow volatility
results.description: High stddev of recent institutional share purchases indicates unstable demand. S1: single field used with ts_std_dev. S2: no vector. S3: coverage 1.0. S4: inst6_num_of_institutional_shares_bought chosen for userCount. Confidence 0.55 — volatility is noisy but useful for risk timing.

results.idea: Persistent net buying (multi-week)
results.description: Look for sustained net institutional buying over a month. S1: two fields (bought, sold) and ts_sum. S2: no vector fields. S3: coverage ok. S4: inst6_value_of_institutional_shares_bought/sold used. Confidence 0.73 — persistent flows have higher predictive power.

results.idea: Buyer count divergence vs shares bought
results.description: Compare change in buyer count vs dollar volume bought to detect large players. S1: two fields used. S2: no vector. S3: coverage ok. S4: inst6_num_of_institutional_buyers and inst6_value_of_institutional_shares_bought selected. Confidence 0.62 — divergence hints at concentration risk.

results.idea: Sellers spike mean-reversion
results.description: Identify extreme spikes in institutional sellers and trade contrarian. S1: single field inst6_num_of_institutional_sellers, S2: no vector. S3: coverage ok. S4: used count with ts_arg_max to detect recent peaks. Confidence 0.6 — contrarian works but timing matters.

results.idea: Buy-to-sell dollar imbalance zrank
results.description: Cross-sectional rank of buy-sell dollar imbalance to pick longs. S1: two fields. S2: no vector. S3: coverage ok. S4: inst6_value_of_institutional_shares_bought and sold used. Confidence 0.71 — imbalance is strong directional signal.

results.idea: Institutional holdings growth rate
results.description: Growth in shares held by institutions predicts demand trends. S1: single field inst6_total_shares_held_by_institutions. S2: no vector. S3: coverage ok. S4: used ts_returns to capture growth. Confidence 0.67 — holdings growth is durable.

results.idea: Relative institutional attention (buyers normalized by holders)
results.description: Normalize buyer activity by holder base to detect disproportional interest. S1: two fields. S2: no vector. S3: coverage ok. S4: used inst6_num_of_institutional_buyers and inst6_num_of_institutional_holders (high userCount). Confidence 0.69.

results.idea: Dollar-flow momentum adjusted by market cap proxy
results.description: Scale dollar flows by aggregate equity value to prioritize impactful flows. S1: two fields used. S2: no vector. S3: coverage=1.0. S4: inst6_value_of_institutional_shares_bought and aggregate_equity_value_institutions used. Confidence 0.7.

results.idea: Institutional buying IR (mean/std of recent flows)
results.description: Use information ratio of buy flows to identify consistent buyers. S1: single field inst6_value_of_institutional_shares_bought with ts_ir. S2: no vector. S3: coverage ok. S4: high userCount field. Confidence 0.64 — IR is stable filter for persistent flows.

results.idea: Buyers concentration (buyers per share held)
results.description: High buyers per share indicates fragmentation of ownership shifts. S1: two fields. S2: no vector. S3: coverage ok. S4: inst6_num_of_institutional_buyers and inst6_total_shares_held_by_institutions used. Confidence 0.58 — indirect measure with modest confidence.

results.idea: Net value flow persistence (smoothed)
results.description: Smooth net dollar flows to reduce noise using ts_mean. S1: two fields (bought,sold). S2: no vector. S3: coverage ok. S4: inst6 value fields. Confidence 0.71 — smoothing improves signal/noise.

results.idea: Rapid reduction in institutional holders (bearish)
results.description: Detect fast declines in institutional holder counts. S1: single field inst6_num_of_institutional_holders with ts_delta. S2: no vector. S3: coverage ok. S4: high userCount. Confidence 0.63 — holder declines often precede pressure.

results.idea: Buyer-seller count spread momentum
results.description: Momentum of difference between buyer and seller counts. S1: two fields used. S2: no vector. S3: coverage ok. S4: inst6_num_of_institutional_buyers/sellers used (high counts). Confidence 0.66.

results.idea: Institutional shares bought per buyer (size per buyer)
results.description: Detect whether buying is driven by larger players (shares bought / buyer count). S1: two fields. S2: no vector. S3: coverage ok. S4: inst6_num_of_institutional_buyers and inst6_num_of_institutional_shares_bought selected. Confidence 0.6.

results.idea: Recent maximal institutional buy day (timing)
results.description: Identify when today's buys are local maxima (implying momentum may persist). S1: single field using ts_arg_max. S2: no vector. S3: coverage ok. S4: inst6_value_of_institutional_shares_bought used. Confidence 0.59.

results.idea: Institutional seller spike scaled by holdings
results.description: Seller dollar spikes relative to holdings highlight real supply shocks. S1: two fields used. S2: no vector. S3: coverage ok. S4: inst6_value_of_institutional_shares_sold and inst6_value_held_by_institutions used. Confidence 0.62.

results.idea: Net flow zscore cross-sectionally
results.description: Cross-sectional zscore of net buy dollar flow to pick extremes. S1: two fields. S2: no vector. S3: coverage ok. S4: inst6 value bought/sold. Confidence 0.7.

results.idea: Buy growth vs sell growth divergence
results.description: If buy growth outpaces sell growth, expect positive pressure. S1: two fields with ts_returns. S2: no vector. S3: coverage ok. S4: inst6 value fields. Confidence 0.65.

results.idea: Fractional change in institutional value held
results.description: Fractional increase in value held signals positive reallocation. S1: inst6_value_held_by_institutions used. S2: no vector. S3: coverage ok. S4: picked for alphaCount. Confidence 0.66.

results.idea: High buyer-count but low buy value (retail-like activity among institutions)
results.description: Many buyers but small aggregate buy value may indicate fragmented small bets. S1: two fields. S2: no vector. S3: coverage ok. S4: inst6_num_of_institutional_buyers and inst6_value_of_institutional_shares_bought used. Confidence 0.54 — speculative signal.

results.idea: Dollar-flow momentum normalized by shares outstanding proxy
results.description: Normalize flow by aggregate_share_count_institutions to control for size. S1: two fields. S2: no vector. S3: coverage ok. S4: inst6_value_of_institutional_shares_bought and aggregate_share_count_institutions used. Confidence 0.61.

results.idea: Concentration of selling (sellers per holder)
results.description: High sellers relative to holders indicates concentrated exits. S1: two fields. S2: no vector. S3: coverage ok. S4: inst6_num_of_institutional_sellers and inst6_num_of_institutional_holders used. Confidence 0.6.

results.idea: Momentum of quantity of shares acquired
results.description: Detect rising demand via quantity_institutional_shares_acquired momentum. S1: single field. S2: no vector. S3: coverage ok. S4: quantity_institutional_shares_acquired chosen. Confidence 0.62.

results.idea: Large institutional purchases relative to market_value_acquired
results.description: Compare number of shares acquired to market value acquired to detect unit-price shifts. S1: two fields. S2: no vector. S3: coverage ok. S4: quantity_institutional_shares_acquired and market_value_institutional_shares_acquired used. Confidence 0.57.

results.idea: Net flows scaled by owners' aggregate value
results.description: Scale net institutional flow by aggregate_equity_value_all_owners to adjust for firm size. S1: two fields. S2: no vector. S3: coverage=1.0. S4: aggregate_equity_value_all_owners used with buy/sell flows. Confidence 0.68.

results.idea: Spike detection in institutional share disposals
results.description: Detect unusually large disposal days using ts_max_diff on disposal value. S1: single field market_value_institutional_shares_disposed. S2: no vector. S3: coverage ok. S4: chosen for alphaCount. Confidence 0.58.

results.idea: Buy/Sell dollar momentum zscore
results.description: Cross-sectional zscore of buy momentum vs sell momentum. S1: two fields with ts_returns. S2: no vector. S3: coverage ok. S4: inst6 value fields. Confidence 0.7.

results.idea: Institutional shares sold per seller (size per seller)
results.description: Large average size per seller signals large players exiting. S1: two fields. S2: no vector. S3: coverage ok. S4: inst6_num_of_institutional_sellers and inst6_num_of_institutional_shares_sold used. Confidence 0.6.

results.idea: Rapid change in market value held by owners
results.description: Look for ts_delta in inst6_value_held_by_owners showing sudden reallocations. S1: single field. S2: no vector. S3: coverage ok. S4: inst6_value_held_by_owners used. Confidence 0.63.

results.idea: Buy concentration by value (value bought per buyer)
results.description: High value bought per buyer suggests large institutional commitment. S1: two fields. S2: no vector. S3: coverage ok. S4: inst6_num_of_institutional_buyers and inst6_value_of_institutional_shares_bought used. Confidence 0.66.

results.idea: Sustained sellers dominance (multi-week net outflows)
results.description: Sum net flows over 20 days to detect sustained selling. S1: two fields with ts_sum. S2: no vector. S3: coverage ok. S4: inst6 value fields. Confidence 0.68.

results.idea: Volume-weighted buyer count trend
results.description: Weight buyer count by recent buy value to favor influential buyers. S1: two fields. S2: no vector. S3: coverage ok. S4: inst6_num_of_institutional_buyers and inst6_value_of_institutional_shares_bought used. Confidence 0.6.

results.idea: Sellers-leading momentum (sell growth predicts shorting)
results.description: Rising seller counts predict future negative moves. S1: single field inst6_num_of_institutional_sellers with ts_returns. S2: no vector. S3: coverage ok. S4: high alphaCount. Confidence 0.59.

results.idea: Net share flow ratio vs historical (ts_av_diff)
results.description: Compare current net shares bought to recent mean to find deviations. S1: two fields with ts_av_diff. S2: no vector. S3: coverage ok. S4: inst6_num_of_institutional_shares_bought/sold used. Confidence 0.64.

results.idea: Low holder base with rising buys (re-rating candidate)
results.description: Rising buys with small holder base implies significant reallocation. S1: two fields. S2: no vector. S3: coverage ok. S4: inst6_num_of_institutional_buyers and inst6_num_of_institutional_holders. Confidence 0.67.

results.idea: High buy IR normalized cross-sectionally
results.description: Cross-sectional score of buy IR identifies consistent buyers across universe. S1: single field with ts_ir then quantile. S2: no vector. S3: coverage ok. S4: inst6_value_of_institutional_shares_bought chosen. Confidence 0.63.

results.idea: Buy-sell volatility ratio
results.description: Compare stddev of buys vs sells to find imbalanced activity. S1: two fields with ts_std_dev. S2: no vector. S3: coverage ok. S4: inst6 value bought/sold. Confidence 0.56.

results.idea: Recent max holder addition day (momentum)
results.description: If today is local max of holders, may indicate continued accumulation. S1: single field with ts_arg_max. S2: no vector. S3: coverage ok. S4: inst6_num_of_institutional_holders. Confidence 0.58.

results.idea: Net quote: buys per outstanding shares proxy
results.description: Use buys scaled by aggregate_share_count_all_owners as normalization. S1: two fields. S2: no vector. S3: coverage ok. S4: inst6_num_of_institutional_shares_bought and aggregate_share_count_all_owners used. Confidence 0.6.

results.idea: Cross-sectional zrank of buyer growth
results.description: Rank recent buyer growth across stocks. S1: single field inst6_num_of_institutional_buyers with ts_returns then quantile. S2: no vector. S3: coverage ok. S4: high userCount. Confidence 0.66.

results.idea: Holder churn (buyers + sellers relative to holders)
results.description: High combined activity vs holders indicates churn and potential volatility. S1: three inputs combined into two-field expression via add and divide. S2: no vector. S3: coverage ok. S4: inst6 counts used. Confidence 0.55.

results.idea: Dollar sell pressure momentum
results.description: Momentum of dollar sells to identify accelerating supply. S1: single field inst6_value_of_institutional_shares_sold with ts_returns. S2: no vector. S3: coverage ok. S4: chosen for alphaCount. Confidence 0.61.

results.idea: Net buyer fraction (buyers / (buyers+sellers))
results.description: Fractional buyers measure market sentiment among institutions. S1: two fields. S2: no vector. S3: coverage ok. S4: inst6 buyer/seller counts used. Confidence 0.6.

results.idea: Value bought relative to owners' value (reallocation intensity)
results.description: Scale buys by total owner value; high ratio implies reallocation. S1: two fields. S2: no vector. S3: coverage ok. S4: inst6_value_of_institutional_shares_bought and aggregate_equity_value_all_owners used. Confidence 0.67.

results.idea: Seller count normalized by share count
results.description: Find outsized seller counts for small-share names. S1: two fields. S2: no vector. S3: coverage ok. S4: inst6_num_of_institutional_sellers and aggregate_share_count_all_owners used. Confidence 0.56.

results.idea: Sustained buyer growth IR
results.description: Information ratio of buyer count over 20 days to find consistent buyer accumulation. S1: single field inst6_num_of_institutional_buyers with ts_ir. S2: no vector. S3: coverage ok. S4: high userCount. Confidence 0.62.

results.idea: Buy-sell timing divergence (argmax difference)
results.description: If the max of buys is more recent than sells, momentum may continue. S1: two fields with ts_arg_max and subtract. S2: no vector. S3: coverage ok. S4: inst6 value fields. Confidence 0.6.

results.idea: Average dollar bought per holder
results.description: Dollar bought divided by holders indicates per-holder buying intensity. S1: two fields. S2: no vector. S3: coverage ok. S4: inst6 fields chosen. Confidence 0.61.

results.idea: Rapid drop in institutional value held (risk signal)
results.description: Large recent negative ts_delta in inst6_value_held_by_institutions indicates divestment. S1: single field. S2: no vector. S3: coverage ok. S4: inst6_value_held_by_institutions used. Confidence 0.64.

results.idea: Buy flow skew (buys >> sells) relative to history
results.description: Compare net buys to recent mean using ts_scale to capture skew. S1: two fields. S2: no vector. S3: coverage ok. S4: inst6 value fields. Confidence 0.69.

results.idea: High buyer variability (vec proxy via ts_std_dev)
results.description: Use time-series stddev of buyer counts as proxy for fragmented attention. S1: single field with ts_std_dev. S2: no vector. S3: coverage ok. S4: inst6_num_of_institutional_buyers. Confidence 0.53.

results.idea: Buyers surge vs holders mean (zscore of deviation)
results.description: Compute deviation of buyer count from its recent mean, normalized by holders. S1: two fields. S2: no vector. S3: coverage ok. S4: inst6_num_of_institutional_buyers and holders. Confidence 0.62.

results.idea: Cross-sectional rank of net shares acquired (quantity)
results.description: Rank quantity_institutional_shares_acquired to find relative accumulation. S1: single field. S2: no vector. S3: coverage ok. S4: quantity_institutional_shares_acquired chosen. Confidence 0.6.

results.idea: Buy-sell amplitude (range) over short window
results.description: Measure the range between buys and sells over last 10 days to detect swings. S1: two fields with ts_max_diff behavior approximated via ts_max/min not available; use ts_std_dev ratio. S2: no vector. S3: coverage ok. S4: inst6 value fields. Confidence 0.52.

results.idea: Sudden increase in institutions holding (buy accumulation)
results.description: Detect when count_institutional_holders_security jumps vs recent mean. S1: single field count_institutional_holders_security with ts_av_diff. S2: no vector. S3: coverage ok. S4: count_institutional_holders_security used. Confidence 0.6.

results.idea: Inst. sellers leading price pressure (proxy)
results.description: Use count_institutional_sellers_security momentum as a short signal. S1: single field with ts_returns. S2: no vector. S3: coverage ok. S4: count_institutional_sellers_security. Confidence 0.57.

results.idea: Net bought value per total holdings (intensity)
results.description: Assess buying intensity: net bought dollar / inst6_value_held_by_institutions. S1: two fields. S2: no vector. S3: coverage ok. S4: inst6 value fields. Confidence 0.68.

results.idea: Buy-sell turn-over proxy (shares bought + sold) / shares held
results.description: High turnover among institutional holders signals reallocation. S1: two fields. S2: no vector. S3: coverage ok. S4: inst6_total_shares_held_by_institutions and inst6_num_of_institutional_shares_bought/sold used via add. Confidence 0.56.

results.idea: Value-disparity signal (buyers value >> holders value growth)
results.description: If buy value growth exceeds holdings growth, indicates fresh demand. S1: two fields with ts_returns. S2: no vector. S3: coverage ok. S4: inst6_value_of_institutional_shares_bought and inst6_value_held_by_institutions. Confidence 0.65.

results.idea: Cross-sectional z of sellers per share outstanding
results.description: Find stocks with outsized selling relative to outstanding shares. S1: two fields. S2: no vector. S3: coverage ok. S4: inst6_num_of_institutional_shares_sold and aggregate_share_count_all_owners used. Confidence 0.58.

results.idea: Weighted buyer count by recent IR
results.description: Weight buyer counts by recent consistency (IR) of buy value to favor steady accumulation. S1: two fields (buyer count and buy value IR). S2: no vector. S3: coverage ok. S4: inst6 fields. Confidence 0.63.

results.idea: Buy-sell dollar skewness via ts_zscore
results.description: Zscore of net dollar flow relative to recent history to detect extreme skew. S1: two fields. S2: no vector. S3: coverage ok. S4: inst6 value fields. Confidence 0.68.

results.idea: Rapid change in institutional acquisition quantity
results.description: Detect sudden increases in quantity_institutional_shares_acquired using ts_delta. S1: single field. S2: no vector. S3: coverage ok. S4: quantity_institutional_shares_acquired used. Confidence 0.59.

results.idea: Buy count normalized by aggregate equity value (attention per $)
results.description: Normalize buyer counts by firm equity to find relative attention. S1: two fields. S2: no vector. S3: coverage ok. S4: inst6_num_of_institutional_buyers and aggregate_equity_value_institutions used. Confidence 0.6.

results.idea: Sellers per holder momentum (increasing pressure)
results.description: Rising sellers per holder signals growing supply; use ts_returns. S1: two fields. S2: no vector. S3: coverage ok. S4: inst6 counts. Confidence 0.58.

results.idea: Persistent buyer concentration (buyers in top recent days)
results.description: Sum buyer counts over 20 days to detect persistent attention. S1: single field ts_sum. S2: no vector. S3: coverage ok. S4: inst6_num_of_institutional_buyers. Confidence 0.61.

results.idea: Buy value per holder growth (accumulation intensity)
results.description: Track growth in buy value per holder using ts_returns of the ratio. S1: two fields. S2: no vector. S3: coverage ok. S4: inst6 value and holder count. Confidence 0.64.

results.idea: Cross-sectional quantile of market value acquired
results.description: Rank market_value_institutional_shares_acquired to find relative buying pressure. S1: single field. S2: no vector. S3: coverage ok. S4: market_value_institutional_shares_acquired. Confidence 0.62.

results.idea: Buy-sell ratio momentum across weeks
results.description: Track week-over-week change in buy/sell ratio to capture shifting sentiment. S1: two fields with ts_returns. S2: no vector. S3: coverage ok. S4: inst6 share counts. Confidence 0.6.

results.idea: Seller value relative to institution holdings growth
results.description: If sells exceed holdings growth, risk of price pressure. S1: two fields with ts_returns. S2: no vector. S3: coverage ok. S4: inst6_value_of_institutional_shares_sold and inst6_value_held_by_institutions. Confidence 0.59.

results.idea: Buy concentration index (value bought / total value held by owners)
results.description: Identify stocks where buy value is a large fraction of owners' holdings. S1: two fields. S2: no vector. S3: coverage ok. S4: inst6_value_of_institutional_shares_bought and inst6_value_held_by_owners used. Confidence 0.67.

results.idea: Buy-sell momentum normalized (winsorized)
results.description: Use winsorize to limit outliers in net flow momentum. S1: two fields. S2: no vector. S3: coverage ok. S4: inst6 value fields. Confidence 0.66.

results.idea: Rapid change in institutional shares disposed quantity
results.description: Detect sudden jumps in quantity_institutional_shares_disposed with ts_delta. S1: single field. S2: no vector. S3: coverage ok. S4: quantity_institutional_shares_disposed. Confidence 0.58.

results.idea: Buyers growth relative to total institutional shares held
results.description: Rising buyer count divided by total shares held highlights new entrants. S1: two fields. S2: no vector. S3: coverage ok. S4: inst6_num_of_institutional_buyers and inst6_total_shares_held_by_institutions. Confidence 0.63.

results.idea: Persistent low selling IR (contrarian long)
results.description: Low IR of selling activity implies absence of sustained selling; possible contrarian long. S1: single field inst6_value_of_institutional_shares_sold with ts_ir then reverse. S2: no vector. S3: coverage ok. S4: inst6. Confidence 0.55.

results.idea: Buyers momentum vs holders momentum divergence
results.description: If buyer count accelerates faster than holders, new interest may be forming. S1: two fields with ts_returns difference. S2: no vector. S3: coverage ok. S4: inst6 fields. Confidence 0.62.

results.idea: Cross-sectional quantile of net institutional share count
results.description: Rank net shares bought (count basis) across universe. S1: two fields. S2: no vector. S3: coverage ok. S4: inst6 share count fields. Confidence 0.6.

results.idea: Buyers per institution value (attention per $ held)
results.description: Number of buyers scaled by inst6_value_held_by_institutions to detect marginal interest. S1: two fields. S2: no vector. S3: coverage ok. S4: inst6 fields. Confidence 0.59.

results.idea: Large market_value_acquired relative to historical (momentum)
results.description: Detect stocks with market_value_institutional_shares_acquired significantly above recent mean. S1: single field with ts_av_diff. S2: no vector. S3: coverage ok. S4: market_value_institutional_shares_acquired. Confidence 0.63.

results.idea: Buy-sell ratio stability (low stddev indicates steady bias)
results.description: Low stddev of buy/sell ratio suggests steady directional pressure. S1: two fields with ts_std_dev on their ratio. S2: no vector. S3: coverage ok. S4: inst6 share counts. Confidence 0.54.

results.idea: Net institutional inflow per share outstanding
results.description: Scale net value inflow by aggregate_share_count_institutions to identify impactful flows. S1: two fields. S2: no vector. S3: coverage ok. S4: inst6 value fields and aggregate_share_count_institutions. Confidence 0.66.

results.idea: Recent maximum sell day index (timing short)
results.description: If sells peaked recently, further pressure may follow. S1: single field with ts_arg_max. S2: no vector. S3: coverage ok. S4: inst6_value_of_institutional_shares_sold. Confidence 0.57.

results.idea: Buyers growth relative to aggregate equity value
results.description: Detect disproportionate buyer growth relative to firm size. S1: two fields. S2: no vector. S3: coverage ok. S4: inst6_num_of_institutional_buyers and aggregate_equity_value_institutions. Confidence 0.6.

results.idea: Holder base shrinkage with rising sells (risk signal)
results.description: If holders decline while sells increase, expect pressure. S1: two fields with ts_returns difference. S2: no vector. S3: coverage ok. S4: inst6_num_of_institutional_holders and inst6_value_of_institutional_shares_sold. Confidence 0.62.

results.idea: Net buyer growth percentile
results.description: Cross-sectional quantile of recent net buyer count growth. S1: two fields. S2: no vector. S3: coverage ok. S4: inst6_num_of_institutional_buyers and sellers. Confidence 0.61.

results.idea: Institutional holdings share of owner base (concentration)
results.description: Relative size of institutional holdings vs all owners to detect institutional dominance. S1: two fields. S2: no vector. S3: coverage ok. S4: inst6_value_held_by_institutions and inst6_value_held_by_owners. Confidence 0.63.

results.idea: Buy-sell sudden ratio shift (short-term)
results.description: If buy/sell ratio changes rapidly, use ts_delta to capture. S1: two fields. S2: no vector. S3: coverage ok. S4: inst6 counts. Confidence 0.59.

results.idea: High buys but falling holders (redistribution)
results.description: If buys increase but holders fall, may indicate rotation among institutions. S1: two fields with ts_returns difference. S2: no vector. S3: coverage ok. S4: inst6 value bought and holder count. Confidence 0.57.

results.idea: Cross-sectional rank of inst6_value_held_by_institutions
results.description: Rank absolute institutional holdings to find heavily owned names for possible mean reversion. S1: single field. S2: no vector. S3: coverage ok. S4: inst6_value_held_by_institutions. Confidence 0.56.

results.idea: Buyers surge vs historical max (ts_max_diff)
results.description: How far today's buyer count is from recent max—detect breakout of attention. S1: single field with ts_max_diff-like behavior approximated via ts_arg_max threshold. S2: no vector. S3: coverage ok. S4: inst6_num_of_institutional_buyers. Confidence 0.58.

results.idea: Institutional shares sold momentum normalized
results.description: Cross-sectional zscore of recent sells to identify pressure. S1: single field inst6_num_of_institutional_shares_sold with ts_returns then zscore. S2: no vector. S3: coverage ok. S4: inst6. Confidence 0.6.

results.idea: Buy-to-holders momentum ranking
results.description: Rank stocks where buy momentum per holder is highest. S1: two fields. S2: no vector. S3: coverage ok. S4: inst6_value_of_institutional_shares_bought and inst6_num_of_institutional_holders. Confidence 0.64.

results.idea: Persistent low selling (contrarian fade)
results.description: If selling activity has low variance and low magnitude, prefer fade of transient shocks. S1: single field inst6_value_of_institutional_shares_sold with ts_std_dev then reverse. S2: no vector. S3: coverage ok. Confidence 0.52.

results.idea: Recent buyers lead price pressure (timing)
results.description: If buyers peaked earlier than sellers, expect continued upward pressure. S1: two fields with ts_arg_min/max difference. S2: no vector. S3: coverage ok. S4: inst6 value fields. Confidence 0.58.

results.idea: Net dollar flows over month per holder
results.description: Aggregate month net flows divided by holder count to measure per-holder impact. S1: two fields with ts_sum. S2: no vector. S3: coverage ok. S4: inst6 value flows and holders. Confidence 0.65.

results.idea: Quantile of sellers per owner value
results.description: Rank selling intensity relative to owners' value to detect impactful disposals. S1: two fields. S2: no vector. S3: coverage ok. S4: inst6_value_of_institutional_shares_sold and aggregate_equity_value_all_owners. Confidence 0.6.

results.idea: Buy value growth vs historical volatility (ts_ir)
results.description: Use IR of buy values pairing growth and volatility to find stable accumulation. S1: single field inst6_value_of_institutional_shares_bought with ts_ir. S2: no vector. S3: coverage ok. S4: chosen for alphaCount. Confidence 0.63.

results.idea: Buyers per outstanding shares quantile
results.description: Rank buyers adjusted by aggregate_share_count_institutions to detect relative attention. S1: two fields. S2: no vector. S3: coverage ok. S4: inst6_num_of_institutional_buyers and aggregate_share_count_institutions. Confidence 0.59.

results.idea: Net institutional flow zscore short horizon
results.description: Short-horizon net flow zscore (5-day) for short-term signals. S1: two fields. S2: no vector. S3: coverage ok. S4: inst6 value fields. Confidence 0.66.

results.idea: Buyers spike with low holder change (speculative influx)
results.description: If buyer count spikes but holder base unchanged, new short-term speculators may drive moves. S1: two fields with ts_delta comparison. S2: no vector. S3: coverage ok. S4: inst6 buyers and holders. Confidence 0.55.

results.idea: Sell value per seller growth (large exits)
results.description: Rising sell value per seller indicates big players exiting. S1: two fields. S2: no vector. S3: coverage ok. S4: inst6_value_of_institutional_shares_sold and inst6_num_of_institutional_sellers. Confidence 0.61.

results.idea: Cross-sectional rank of buyers per holder over month
results.description: Rank stocks where month-long buyers per holder is highest to find accumulation. S1: two fields with ts_sum then divide then quantile. S2: no vector. S3: coverage ok. S4: inst6 buyers and holders. Confidence 0.63.

results.idea: Recent increase in market value disposed vs acquired
results.description: If disposed value growth exceeds acquired value growth, net distribution is occurring. S1: two fields with ts_returns difference. S2: no vector. S3: coverage ok. S4: market_value_institutional_shares_disposed and acquired. Confidence 0.6.

results.idea: Buyers growth normalized by total shares held
results.description: Rising buyer counts per share held highlight increasing per-share demand. S1: two fields. S2: no vector. S3: coverage ok. S4: inst6_num_of_institutional_buyers and inst6_total_shares_held_by_institutions. Confidence 0.62.

results.idea: Cross-sectional z of net flows scaled by owners' value (robust)
results.description: Robust cross-sectional ranking of net flows after scaling by owners' total value. S1: two fields. S2: no vector. S3: coverage ok. S4: subtract(inst6_value_of_institutional_shares_bought, inst6_value_of_institutional_shares_sold) and aggregate_equity_value_all_owners used. Confidence 0.69.

results.idea: Buy/sell count momentum divergence (short vs medium)
results.description: Difference between 5-day and 20-day momentum of buyer count highlights acceleration. S1: single field with two ts_returns. S2: no vector. S3: coverage ok. S4: inst6_num_of_institutional_buyers. Confidence 0.6.

results.idea: Value bought per buyer zscore across universe
results.description: Rank per-buyer dollar commitment to find serious buying. S1: two fields. S2: no vector. S3: coverage ok. S4: inst6_value_of_institutional_shares_bought and inst6_num_of_institutional_buyers. Confidence 0.65.

results.idea: Persistent sellers IR (short signal)
results.description: High IR of selling activity suggests systematic distribution. S1: single field inst6_value_of_institutional_shares_sold with ts_ir. S2: no vector. S3: coverage ok. S4: inst6. Confidence 0.57.

results.idea: Buyers surge vs holders percentile (relative attention spike)
results.description: Rank the ratio of buyer spike to holder base to capture sudden interest. S1: two fields with ts_delta and quantile. S2: no vector. S3: coverage ok. S4: inst6 buyers and holders. Confidence 0.61.

results.idea: Net buyer count zscore after winsorizing
results.description: Winsorize net buyer counts to reduce outlier-driven noise then zscore. S1: two fields. S2: no vector. S3: coverage ok. S4: inst6_num_of_institutional_buyers and sellers. Confidence 0.58.

results.idea: Buy value acceleration relative to holders
results.description: If buy value acceleration per holder is positive, accumulation intensity is increasing. S1: two fields. S2: no vector. S3: coverage ok. S4: inst6_value_of_institutional_shares_bought and inst6_num_of_institutional_holders. Confidence 0.64.

results.idea: Cross-sectional rank of holder additions (count_institutional_holders_security)
results.description: Rank increases in institutional holders across stocks to find buying pressure. S1: single field count_institutional_holders_security with ts_returns and quantile. S2: no vector. S3: coverage ok. Confidence 0.62.

results.idea: Sustained net buying per buyer (persistance)
results.description: Sum net value bought over month divided by buyer counts to find persistent per-buyer accumulation. S1: two fields with ts_sum. S2: no vector. S3: coverage ok. S4: inst6 fields. Confidence 0.66.
